line: Gonococcus! Spirochete! Vladimir sways back and forth, doubled in two.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Dance, hog! (He writhes. Exit Estragon left, precipitately.) I can't! (He looks up, misses Estragon.) Gogo! (He moves wildly about the stage. Enter Estragon left, panting. He hastens towards Vladimir, falls into his arms.) There you are again at last!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Where were you? I thought you were gone for ever.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (triumphantly). It's Godot! At last! Gogo! It's Godot! We're saved! Let's go and meet him! (He drags Estragon towards the wings. Estragon resists, pulls himself free, exit right.) Gogo! Come back! (Vladimir runs to extreme left, scans the horizon. Enter Estragon right, he hastens towards Vladimir, falls into his arms.) There you are again again!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We're surrounded! (Estragon makes a rush towards back.) Imbecile! There's no way out there. (He takes Estragon by the arm and drags him towards front. Gesture towards front.) There! Not a soul in sight! Off you go! Quick! (He pushes Estragon towards auditorium. Estragon recoils in horror.) You won't? (He contemplates auditorium.) Well I can understand that. Wait till I see. (He reflects.) Your only hope left is to disappear.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Where? VLADIMIR:Behind the tree. (Estragon hesitates.) Quick! Behind the tree. (Estragon goes and crouches behind the tree, realizes he is not hidden, comes out from behind the tree.) Decidedly this tree will not have been the slightest use to us.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (calmer). I lost my head. Forgive me. It won't happen again. Tell me what to do.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You go and stand there. (He draws Vladimir to extreme right and places him with his back to the stage.) There, don't move, and watch out. (Vladimir scans horizon, screening his eyes with his hand. Estragon runs and takes up same position extreme left. They turn their heads and look at each other.) Back to back like in the good old days. (They continue to look at each other for a moment, then resume their watch. Long silence.) Do you see anything coming?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Nor I. They resume their watch. Silence.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You must have had a vision. ESTRAGON:(turning his head). What?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (louder). You must have had a vision.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: No need to shout! They resume their watch. Silence. VLADIMIR and ESTRAGON: (turning simultaneously). Do you—
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: On the contrary. They glare at each other angrily.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Finish your phrase, I tell you!ESTRAGON: Finish your own! Silence. They draw closer, halt.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: That's the idea, let's abuse each other. They turn, move apart, turn again and face each other.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Oh! He wilts, vanquished, and turns away.ESTRAGON: Now let's make it up.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Off we go! They embrace. # They separate. Silence.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: How time flies when one has fun! Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Off we go. Vladimir hops from one foot to the other. Estragon imitates him.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (stopping). That's enough. I'm tired. VLADIMIR:(stopping). We're not in shape. What about a little deep breathing?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You're right. (Pause.) Let's just do the tree, for the balance.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: The tree? Vladimir does the tree, staggering about on one leg.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (stopping). Your turn. Estragon does the tree, staggers.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Do you think God sees me?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You must close your eyes. Estragon closes his eyes, staggers worse.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (stopping, brandishing his fists, at the top of his voice.) God have pity on me!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: On me! On me! Pity! On me! Enter Pozzo and Lucky. Pozzo is blind. Lucky burdened as before. Rope as before, but much shorter, so that Pozzo may follow more easily. Lucky wearing a different hat. At the sightof Vladimir and Estragon he stops short. Pozzo, continuing on his way, bumps into him.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (clutching onto Lucky who staggers). What is it? Who is it? Lucky falls, drops everything and brings down Pozzo with him. They lie helpless among the scattered baggage.
speaker: POZZO

line: At last! (He goes towards the heap.) Reinforcements at last!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We were beginning to weaken. Now we're sure to see the evening out.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We are no longer alone, waiting for the night, waiting for Godot, waiting for . . . waiting. All evening we have struggled, unassisted. Now it's over. It's already tomorrow. POZZO:Help!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Time flows again already. The sun will set, the moon rise, and we away . . . from here.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Here! Here! Help me up! VLADIMIR:He can't get up.
speaker: POZZO

line: Perhaps he has another bone for you.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Perhaps we should help him first.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: To do what?VLADIMIR: To get up.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I don't know. Pozzo writhes, groans, beats the ground with his fists.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We should ask him for the bone first. Then if he refuses we'll leave him there.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You mean we have him at our mercy?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: And that we should subordinate our good offices to certain conditions?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: What?VLADIMIR: That seems intelligent all right. But there's one thing I'm afraid of.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: That Lucky might get going all of a sudden. Then we'd be ballocksed.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: The one that went for you yesterday.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I tell you there was ten of them.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: No, before that, the one that kicked you.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: As large as life. (Gesture towards Lucky.) For the moment he is inert. But he might run amuck any minute.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: And suppose we gave him a good beating, the two of us.VLADIMIR: You mean if we fell on him in his sleep?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: That seems a good idea all right. But could we do it? Is he really asleep? (Pause.) No, the best would be to take advantage of Pozzo's calling for help—
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: In anticipation of some tangible return.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Let us not waste our time in idle discourse! (Pause. Vehemently.) Let us do something, while we have the chance! It is not every day that we are needed. Not indeed that we personally are needed. Others would meet the case equally well, if not better. To all mankind they were addressed, those cries for help still ringing in our ears! But at this place, at this moment of time, all mankind is us, whether we like it or not. Let us make the most of it, before it is too late! Let us represent worthily for once the foul brood to which a cruel fate consigned us! What do you say? (Estragon says nothing.) It is true that when with folded arms we weigh the pros and cons we are noless a credit to our species. The tiger bounds to the help of his congeners without the least reflection, or else he slinks away into the depths of the thickets. But that is not the question. What are we doing here, that is the question. And we are blessed in this, that we happen to know the answer. Yes, in this immense confusion one thing alone is clear. We are waiting for Godot to come—
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Or for night to fall. (Pause.) We have kept our appointment and that's an end to that. We are not saints, but we have kept our appointment. How many people can boast as much?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: All I know is that the hours are long, under these conditions, and constrain us to beguile them with proceedings which –how shall I say– which may at first sight seem reasonable, until they become a habit. You may say it is to prevent our reasonfrom foundering. No doubt. But has it not long been straying in the night without end of the abyssal depths? That's what I sometimes wonder. You follow my reasoning?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (aphoristic for once). We are all born mad. Some remain so.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I wouldn't go so far as that.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: No, I mean so far as to assert that I was weak in the head when I came into the world. But that is not the question.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We wait. We are bored. (He throws up his hand.) No, don't protest, we are bored to death, there's no denying it. Good. A diversion comes along and what do we do? We let it go to waste. Come, let's get to work! (He advances towards the heap, stops in his stride.) In an instant all will vanish and we'll be alone once more, in the midst of nothingness!He broods.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We're coming! He tries to pull Pozzo to his feet, fails, tries again, stumbles, falls, tries to get up, fails.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: What's the matter with you all?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Don't leave me! They'll kill me!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Help me up first, then we'll go together.ESTRAGON: You promise?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I've always wanted to wander in the Pyrenees.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Quick! Give me your hand! ESTRAGON:I'm going. (Pause. Louder.) I'm going.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Well I suppose in the end I'll get up by myself. (He tries, fails.) In the fullness of time.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Come on, get up, you'll catch a chill.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Come on, Didi, don't be pig-headed! He stretches out his hand which Vladimir makes haste to seize.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Pull! Estragon pulls, stumbles, falls. Long silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (violently). Will you stop it, you! Pest! He can think of nothing but himself!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Did you hear him? He wants to know what happened!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Don't mind him. Sleep. Silence.POZZO: Pity! Pity!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: It's this bastard Pozzo at it again.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Make him stop it. Kick him in the crotch.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (striking Pozzo). Will you stop it! Crablouse! (Pozzo extricates himself with cries of pain and crawls away. He stops, saws the air blindly, calling for help. Vladimir, propped on his elbow, observes his retreat.) He's off! (Pozzo collapses.) He's down! #
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Perhaps I could crawl to him.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Or I could call to him.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Yes, call to him.VLADIMIR: Pozzo! (Silence.) Pozzo! (Silence.) No reply.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Together. VLADIMIR and ESTRAGON: Pozzo! Pozzo!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Are you sure his name is Pozzo?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (alarmed). Mr. Pozzo! Come back! We won't hurt you! Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We might try him with other names.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: To try him with other names, one after the other. It'd pass the time. And we'd be bound to hit on the right one sooner or later.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I tell you his name is Pozzo.ESTRAGON: We'll soon see. (He reflects.) Abel! Abel!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I begin to weary of this motif.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Perhaps the other is called Cain. Cain! Cain!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: He's all humanity. (Silence.) Look at the little cloud.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Well? (Pause.) What is there so wonderful about it? Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Let's pass on now to something else, do you mind?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I was just going to suggest it.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Suppose we got up to begin with?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: No harm trying. They get up.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Ah! (Despairing.) What'll we do, what'll we do! POZZO:Help!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: He wants us to help him get up.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Then why don't we? What are we waiting for? They help Pozzo to his feet, let him go. He falls.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: We must hold him. (They get him up again. Pozzo sags between them, his arms round their necks.) # Feeling better?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Perhaps he can see into the future.VLADIMIR: Since when?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I used to have wonderful sight— but are you friends?
speaker: POZZO

line: (laughing noisily). He wants to know if we are friends!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: No, he means friends of his.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We've proved we are, by helping him.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Exactly. Would we have helped him if we weren't his friends?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Don't let's quibble about that now.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Highwaymen! Do we look like highwaymen?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Damn it can't you see the man is blind! ESTRAGON:Damn it so he is. (Pause.) So he says.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (inspecting the sky). Seven o'clock . . . eight o'clock . . .
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: That depends what time of year it is.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Is it evening? Silence. Vladimir and Estragon scrutinize the sunset.
speaker: POZZO

line: Don't be a fool. It's the west over there.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: How do you know? POZZO:(anguished). Is it evening?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (reassuring). It's evening, Sir, it's evening, night is drawing nigh. My friend here would have me doubt it and I must confess he shook me for a moment. But it is not for nothing I have lived through this long day and I can assure you it is very near the end of its repertory. (Pause.) How do you feel now?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: How much longer are we to cart him around? (They half release him, catch him again as he falls.) We are not caryatids!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You were saying your sight used to be good, if I heard you right.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (irritably). Expand! Expand! VLADIMIR:Let him alone. Can't you see he's thinking of the days when he was happy. (Pause.) Memoria praeteritorum bonorum— that must be unpleasant.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: And it came on you all of a sudden?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I'm asking you if it came on you all of a sudden.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I woke up one fine day as blind as Fortune. (Pause.) Sometimes I wonder if I'm not still asleep.
speaker: POZZO

line: (violently). Don't question me! The blind have no notion of time. The things of time are hidden from them too.
speaker: POZZO

line: Well just fancy that! I could have sworn it was just the opposite.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: It isn't by any chance the place known as the Board?
speaker: POZZO

line: (looking round). It's indescribable. It's like nothing. There's nothing. There's a tree.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Why doesn't he answer when I call?
speaker: POZZO

line: I don't know. He seems to be sleeping. Perhaps he's dead.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: The two of you slipped. (Pause.) And fell.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Go and see is he hurt.
speaker: POZZO

line: After what he did to me? Never!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Yes yes, let your friend go, he stinks so. (Silence.) What is he waiting for?
speaker: POZZO

line: Well to begin with he should pull on the rope, as hard as he likes so long as he doesn't strangle him. He usually respondsto that. If not he should give him a taste of his boot, in the face and the privates as far as possible.
speaker: POZZO

line: (to Estragon). You see, you've nothing to be afraid of. It's even an opportunity to revenge yourself.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: No no, he never defends himself.
speaker: POZZO

line: I'll come flying to the rescue.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Don't take your eyes off me. He goes towards Lucky.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Make sure he's alive before you start. No point in exerting yourself if he's dead.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Then let him have it. With sudden fury Estragon starts kicking Lucky, hurling abuse at him as he does so. But he hurts his foot and moves away, limping and groaning. Lucky stirs.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Oh the brute! He sits down on the mound and tries to take off his boot. But he soon desists and disposes himself for sleep, his arms on his knees and his head on his arms.POZZO: What's gone wrong now?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: We met yesterday. (Silence.) Do you not remember? POZZO:I don't remember having met anyone yesterday. But tomorrow I won't remember having met anyone today. So don't count on me to enlighten you.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: You were bringing him to the fair to sell him. You spoke to us. He danced. He thought. You had your sight.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: As you please. Let me go! (Vladimir moves away.) Up! Lucky gets up, gathers up his burdens.
speaker: POZZO

line: Where do you go from here?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: On. (Lucky, laden down, takes his place before Pozzo.) Whip! (Lucky puts everything down, looks for whip, finds it, puts it into Pozzo's hand, takes up everything again.) Rope! Lucky puts everything down, puts end of rope into Pozzo's hand, takes up everything again.
speaker: POZZO

line: What is there in the bag?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: What do you do when you fall far from help?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We wait till we can get up. Then we go on. On!
speaker: POZZO

line: Before you go tell him to sing.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Yes. Or to think. Or to recite.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (suddenly furious.) Have you not done tormenting me with your accursed time! It's abominable! When! When! One day, is that not enough for you, one day he went dumb, one day Iwent blind, one day we'll go deaf, one day we were born, one day we shall die, the same day, the same second, is that not enough for you? (Calmer.) They give birth astride of a grave, the light gleams an instant, then it's night once more. (He jerks the rope.) On! Exeunt Pozzo and Lucky. Vladimir follows them to the edge of the stage, looks after them. The noise of falling, reinforced by mimic of Vladimir, announces that they are down again. Silence. Vladimir goes towards Estragon, contemplates him a moment, then shakes him awake.
speaker: POZZO

line: (wild gestures, incoherent words. Finally.) Why will you never let me sleep?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I was dreaming I was happy.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (violently). Don't tell me! (Silence.) I wonder is he really blind.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Blind?VLADIMIR: He told us he was blind.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: It seemed to me he saw us.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: You dreamt it. (Pause.) Let's go. We can't. Ah! (Pause.) Are you sure it wasn't him?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Not at all! (Less sure.) Not at all! (Still less sure.) Not at all!
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I suppose I might as well get up. (He gets up painfully.) Ow! Didi!
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I don't know what to think any more.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: My feet! (He sits down again and tries to take off his boots.) Help me!VLADIMIR: Was I sleeping, while the others suffered? Am I sleeping now? Tomorrow, when I wake, or think I do, what shall I say of today? That with Estragon my friend, at this place, until the fall of night, I waited for Godot? That Pozzo passed, with his carrier, and that he spoke to us? Probably. But in all that what truth will there be? (Estragon, having struggled with his boots in vain, is dozing off again. Vladimir looks at him.) He'll know nothing. He'll tell me about the blows he received and I'll give him a carrot. (Pause.) Astride of a grave and a difficult birth. Down in the hole, lingeringly, the grave digger puts on the forceps. We have time to grow old. The air is full of our cries. (He listens.) But habit is a great deadener. (He looks again at Estragon.) At me too someone is looking, of me too someone is saying, He is sleeping, he knows nothing, let him sleep on. (Pause.) I can't go on! (Pause.) What have I said? He goes feverishly to and fro, halts finally at extreme left, broods. Enter Boy right. He halts. Silence.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Off we go again. (Pause.) Do you not recognize me?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: This is your first time.BOY: Yes Sir. Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: You have a message from Mr. Godot.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Two other . . . (he hesitates) . . . men? BOY:I didn't see anyone, Sir. Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: What does he do, Mr. Godot? (Silence.) Do you hear me?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Perhaps it was he came yesterday.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (softly). Has he a beard, Mr. Godot?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Fair or . . . (he hesitates) . . . or black? BOY:I think it's white, Sir. Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Christ have mercy on us! Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: What am I to tell Mr. Godot, Sir?
speaker: BOY

line: Tell him . . . (he hesitates) . . . tell him you saw me and that . . . (he hesitates) . . . that you saw me. (Pause. Vladimir advances, the Boy recoils. Vladimir halts, the Boy halts. With sudden violence.) You're sure you saw me, you won't come and tell me tomorrow that you never saw me! Silence. Vladimir makes a sudden spring forward, the Boy avoids him and exits running. Silence. The sun sets, the moon rises. As in Act 1. Vladimir stands motionless and bowed. Estragon wakes, takes off his boots, gets up with one in each hand and goes and puts them down center front, then goes towards Vladimir.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Was I long asleep?VLADIMIR: I don't know. Silence.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Oh yes, let's go far away from here.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: We have to come back tomorrow.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Yes, now it's night.ESTRAGON: And if we dropped him? (Pause.) If we dropped him?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: He'd punish us. (Silence. He looks at the tree.) Everything's dead but the tree.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: (looking at the tree). What is it?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: I don't know. A willow. Estragon draws Vladimir towards the tree. They stand motionless before it. Silence.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: You haven't got a bit of rope?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Then we can't. Silence. VLADIMIR:Let's go.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You could hang onto my legs.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Show me all the same. (Estragon loosens the cord that holds up his trousers which, much too big for him, fall about his ankles. They look at the cord.) It might do in a pinch. But is it strong enough?
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We'll soon see. Here. They each take an end of the cord and pull. # It breaks. They almost fall.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: You say we have to come back tomorrow?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Yes.ESTRAGON: Then we can bring a good bit of rope.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: I can't go on like this.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: If we parted? That might be better for us.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: We'll hang ourselves tomorrow. (Pause.) Unless Godot comes.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: We'll be saved. Vladimir takes off his hat (Lucky's), peers inside it, feels about inside it, shakes it, knocks on the crown, puts it on again.
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: You want me to pull off my trousers?
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: (realizing his trousers are down). True. He pulls up his trousers.
speaker: ESTRAGON

line: Well? Shall we go? ESTRAGON: Yes, let's go. They do not move. Curtain
speaker: VLADIMIR

line: Yes, let's go. They do not move. Curtain
speaker: ESTRAGON
